p: The toxicity of several medicinal plants have been well documented [ 22, 23]. Hence, the safety status of all potential medicinal plants has to be investigated before further exploration. Based on the OECD guideline 425 [ 15] of acute toxicity studies, the LD50 was found to be > 2000 mg/kg. Since the LD50 of the plant's hydroalcoholic extract was found to be more than three times the minimum effective dose (200 mg/kg), it was taken as a good candidate for further studies [ 24, 25].
